title: Dependency Injection
description:
Gazel uses Castle.Windsor for Dependency Injection. Using Convention over
Configuration capabilities of Castle.Windsor, you don't have to register your
classes one by one. Every public class in module projects are automatically
registered to the kernel. In this document you will find ways on how to make
use of this feature.

children.value:
for Dependency Injection. Using Convention over
Configuration capabilities of Castle.Windsor, you don't have to register your
classes one by one. Every public class in module projects are automatically
registered to the kernel. In this document you will find ways on how to make
use of this feature.
Transient: For every resolution, Windsor creates a new instance.

Request: For every request there is only one instance. After the request
ends, object is disposed.
Singleton: There is only one instance until application is shut down.

classes are singleton by convention and the rest are
transient.
For a class to be a manager class, it should have
Manager classes are singleton by convention. You can make use of

classes to provide general domain logic of a module, batch operations or
complex query services.

Every public class is registered to Castle.Windsor by their own type so that
they can be injected to other classes.
Every public class should contain a

constructor, in order for
Castle.Windsor to register and configure them.
Avoid creating circular dependencies as shown below;
Consider refactoring your code. Two classes shouldn't depend on each other.

If you think you have no other choice, then you can refactor code as shown
below;

is basically an abstraction for your domain objects to be
isolated from the 3rd party libraries.

objects, we encourage you to inject
them through constructor. On the other hand, if you want to create a transient
object, you can make use of
Public classes can also be injected using their interfaces

If an interface has more than one implementations then you can inject all of

title: Business Services
description:
Gazel configures Routine to expose every public method to be a business
service. A business service is a public method that you can call using HTTP.

children.value:
to expose every public method to be a business
service. A business service is a public method that you can call using HTTP.
methods are directly exposed as business services.

You can use a persistent object directly in your business methods. Gazel will
automatically lookup for a record with given id. If record is not found, it
will automatically throw

Therefore, with the above code, you ensured that district is either null or an
existing record in database.

Method overloads are considered as one business service in service layer. If
you create method overloads like below, then you will see only one business
service with all of parameters.

then the first overload will be called, if
you fulfill all parameters, then the second overload will be called.

Overload selection is automatic, and Gazel will try to pass as many
parameters as it can. Assume that you send
service. Then first overload matches only

parameter, but
second overload matches both of them. So invocation will be on the second one
and

If return type of overloads are not the same, the first overload will be a
business service, but the second one will be ignored.
// Second overload returns Branch, this will not be a business service.

Gazel supports optional parameters in business services. You can use
optional parameters instead of overloads.

class for both parameters and return types as long as type
parameter
for lists is a supported type.

in business services by design. So any
service with Dictionary parameter or return type will not be exposed as a
business service. The reason behind this design decision is to favor
strongly-typed classes over generic dictionaries.

If you need a type other than persistent class or a primitive for input or
output, then you can make use of DTOs.
Example usage of a DTO with business service;

By definition DTOs are expected to be only used for data transfer with no
business logic and for this reason Gazel uses

You can define a record with using positional syntax. With this syntax,
compiler generates your record as a class with init only public properties and
a public constructor.

props.code: public record BranchInfo(string Name, string Address, City City, Country Country);

children.value: (string Name, string Address, City City, Country Country);

Constructor parameters of record DTOs are just like parameters of business
services. You can use

other DTOs
as parameters of constructor.

You can use constructor overloads if you need some construction logic or
validation when creating your DTOs.
Example usage of a record with a constructor overloads.
(string Name, string Address, City City, Country Country)
You can use optional or calculated properties in records, without adding a constructor overload.
(string Name, City City, Country Country, string Address = default)

If you need to keep some properties or methods only for internal business
logic, you can use
// this constructor will not be rendered in client APIs,
// it will only be available for your business services
Example usage of record with internal constructor with business service;

DTOs are currently supported as legacy for backward compatibility
and may not be available on future releases. We recommend you to use
Below is a struct implementation of

In some cases you might need to have a public method, but you might not want it
to be exposed as a business service. In this kind of cases, you can mark a
business service by adding an

class and all of its members will be hidden in service
layer.
method will be hidden in service layer.
will be available in service layer

title: Data Persistence
description:
Gazel configures NHibernate with the help of Fluent NHibernate to
provide a data persistence layer.

children.value:
to
provide a data persistence layer.

if its class injects its own repository. This
convention ensures that there is only one class to deal with one table in the
database.

This injection tells Gazel to configure this class to be a persistent class
which means that there will be an ORM configuration for this class.

constructor is there for NHibernate to be able to
create proxies on persistent classes for lazy loading.

When you have a persistent class, this means that you will need to read
persistent objects from corresponding database table. That's why Gazel requires
you to create a query class for every persistent class.

It's better to put persistent and query classes of a table into one source
file.

In this document we will explain persistent classes rather than query classes.
You can find detailed explanation for queries in
Every persistent class should have an identifier property of type

This property will be used by NHibernate to be the primary key and first level
caching.

Id properties are automatically configured to be an identity column which
means that database is responsible for assigning Id values.
Every member in persistent classes (methods and properties) should be
in order NHibernate to be able to create proxies for lazy loading.

access modifier causes null reference
exceptions. Use

We encourage you to use protected setters so that you can make sure that no
other class than the class itself is able to modify the values of its
properties.

setters but NHibernate wouldn't be able to create
proxies for lazy loading.
For a more detailed explanation please have a look at

which does what it says. The
convention for insert operations is as follows;

pattern for this operation. For a more detailed explanation about
methods please have a look at
because of NHibernate's lazy loading requirements,

Below you can see an example of an insert operation;

When a persistent object is loaded, its state is managed by NHibernate. This
feature of NHibernate enables services to  automatically update a record upon
commit.
Above method is enough for the

object to update itself. At this point
object is marked as dirty by NHibernate. Whenever NHibernate session is
flushed, an update statement will be executed in the database. There are 3
reasons for NHibernate session to be flushed;

When current transaction is committed NHibernate flushes current session,
hence record gets updated.
When a select query is sent to

table, either directly or via table
joins.
You make an explicit call to

which calls
NHibernate's session flush directly.

causes all dirty objects to be flushed, not just the
persistent object it is called, nor instances of

. This is how
NHibernate implements session flush.
method iterates through a list of

objects.
Changing a property value does not cause an immediate update. Upon NHibernate
session flush, above updates will be executed as batch.
If you execute a query to

method, this
will cause NHibernate to flush on every iteration and cause an update
execution one by one. This can create a performance flaw in your code. If you
need to check something before such an update (e.g. checking if new username
exists before updating it), and if you want the operation to be a batch
update, then you need to optimize your query accordingly. For "unique
username" example, you might consider checking uniqueness at once.

, this means that with every
update to objects of that class, Gazel will automatically update values of
properties. A force update is handy when you only want to update

). You can force an object to be
updated using

In the above example, we want a company record to be updated whenever an
employee is added to it. Since adding an employee does not cause an update to a
company record, we force company objects to be updated upon adding an employee.
This
call will cause a company object's
If given persistent class does not implement

If a persistent object is already dirty and forced to be updated, there will
be only one
statement to update changes to database.

Behaviour of delete operations are similar to update operations. If you do it
like above, delete statements will be executed when NHibernate session is
flushed. If you execute a query before deleting, this would prevent NHibernate
from performing a batch operation. For detailed explanation have a look at

title: Relations
description: Gazel configures NHibernate so that you can define relations intiutively.

children.value: Gazel configures NHibernate so that you can define relations intiutively.
This relation is the most used type among all and the simplest one.
Above code is enough to set a many-to-one relation between

table will require a column
named

property as a many to one
relation.

Gazel configures NHibernate to eager fetch persistent object with one level.
This means that when you query a list of persistent objects, their parents will
be fetched eagerly using an inner join. But their grandparents will be
lazy-loaded.
When you query employees with something like

objects eagerly fetched. However, when you try to access
a property of their

object (other than Id property), a query will be
executed using that
//No query is executed, department is already loaded
//A query is executed to load company object from database

Above code causes N+1 select problem, which can be a performance issue. If you
encounter this problem, you need to consider selecting all grandparents
(

) with an additional query so that there
will be only 2 queries in total.
//No query is executed, department is already loaded
//No query is executed, company is already loaded with the second query.

This relation type enables you to map your properties to interfaces, which we
refer to as
For NHibernate to map this property to a table it needs two columns;
: The id value of related record, like in a Many-to-One relation,

NHibernate uses type column to know which table to select. This type
information is retrieved from an enum that corresponds to
There should be an enum named
Each enum member must be a persistent class and implement
is mapped to a persistent class with a property named

) column stores the id value of the related
record
In a query method, you can filter by object like this;
Or you can filter by type like this;

Unfortunately interface mappings cannot be fetched eagerly. So beware of N+1
select problems if you use this feature.

title: Queries
description:
For persistence classes, there needs to be corresponding query class to read
records from database. This section focuses on how you can organize your
queries in your projects.

children.value:
For persistence classes, there needs to be corresponding query class to read
records from database. This section focuses on how you can organize your
queries in your projects.
You can access pluralization service through
If pluralization service does not provide what you want, you can make use of
convention. For instance, there is a persistent class named

,
when you name its query class as
Query classes are singleton by convention and its usage is as follows;

Query classes are singleton by convention, so you can inject query classes as
well;

which is an abstract class with helper
functionalities to make it simple to implement query methods. To provide these
functionalities it requires

If you want to inject other dependencies, you are free to do it like in any
other class.
By methods are type of queries that return list of persistent objects.

base class to help you create query
methods quickly.
method accepts an expression that is converted to

. This
expression never runs in your .NET application. Because of this reason you
are not supposed to call methods of persistent classes within these
expressions.  For example;

A by method can also be implemented like below;

. This interface acts as a gateway to NHibernate.
instance. You may use this instance when

When there is only one parameter in query methods, we suggest you to include
parameter name in method name like below;
Consider you have two different queries on
extensions methods. They are optional parameters.

parameter extracts the first n elements from the beginning of the target
sequence. Here is how you can do it;

parameter moves pass the first n elements from the beginning of the
target sequence, returning the remainder;
You can apply pagination by using

optional parameters. Here
is how you can do it;
Alternatively, you can also be implemented by using

as shown
below. It actually returns an

props.code:
public class Company { ... }

public class Companies : Query<Company>
{
    ...
    public List<Company> By(string name, City city, int take) =>
        Lookup
            .List(true)
            .Where(c => c.Name.Contains(name) && c.City == city)
            .Take(take)
            .ToList();;

    public List<Company> By(string name, City city, int skip) =>
        Lookup
            .List(true)
            .Where(c => c.Name.Contains(name) && c.City == city)
            .Skip(skip)
            .ToList();;

    public List<Company> By(string name, City city, int take, int skip) =>
        Lookup
            .List(true)
            .Where(c => c.Name.Contains(name) && c.City == city)
            .OrderByDescending(c => c.City)
            .Skip(skip)
            .Take(take)
            .ToList();
    ...
}

title: Transaction Management
description:
Business services always runs in a transaction context. Its either main
transaction or manually created transactions. In this section you can learn how
we deal with database transactions.

children.value:
Business services always runs in a transaction context. Its either main
transaction or manually created transactions. In this section you can learn how
we deal with database transactions.

Before every service call, Gazel creates a database connection and begins a
transaction. If there occurs an exception the transaction is automatically
rolled back. If there are no exceptions than transaction is committed.
If you want to disable this main transaction behaviour, simply put

attribute to the service method. This will prevent a
transaction to be opened.

you are not allowed to use a persistent
object as a parameter because there will be no transaction or connection to
fetch that persistent object.

Disabling main transaction can help when you need to make an external or
internal API call before you make any database operation. Normally, when you
make an API call, you left a connection and a transaction open and waiting in
an idle state. If your service requires an external call, we suggest you to
disable main transaction and make your external calls without blocking a
connection.

interfaces on
persistent classes. You need to check if there is a transaction before
accessing the database. You may use
// no connection is used until unit converter service responds
// new transaction is used to log conversion into db

method to obtain a new connection and a
transaction within a service. This feature is explained in detail in the
following section.

Most of the time one transaction will be enough for business services. However
there are cases when you will need a record to be updated or inserted and
committed to database.
//Above insert will not be rolled back

creates a new
database connection and begins a transaction on this new connection to provide
you with a new transaction context.

When an exception occurs in a transaction scope, Gazel catches the exception,
rollbacks the transcation, closes the connection and rethrows the exception.
In previous example we used a variable (

) from outer scope. This is not a
problem when variables are non-persistent objects such as
Consider you need to pass a persistent object to

When you pass a persistent object directly to a new transaction context, this
means that a
instance from outer scope will be assigned to an

instance from inner scope. This causes an unexpected state for
NHibernate. To assign a persistent object to another persistent object, they
need to be loaded from the same transaction scope and

instance. To
achieve this you need to pass
//correct way to pass a persistent object to new transaction

. When you do
this, Gazel gets the id of given

, loads it in new transaction
scope and passes it as a parameter (
You can create as many nested transactions as you want like below;

When you create nested transactions, beware that you are using more than one
database connections at a time.

title: Exception Handling
description:
Gazel uses .NET exceptions to handle errors in your business code. For every
error message there should be a corresponding exception class.

children.value:
Gazel uses .NET exceptions to handle errors in your business code. For every
error message there should be a corresponding exception class.

Create a parent static class for each group of your exceptions and define all
related exceptions under this class as a nested class.

to be treated as handled
errors. Handled errors are HTTP status

in REST API and they are logged
in
All other exceptions are treated as unhandled errors with code
level and HTTP status is always

is a class that generates error codes, but we will mention this
later in this section. You can find a detailed description in
To throw an exception you can use

props.code: using static MyProduct.CommonExceptions;

children.value: And then just throw the exception like any other .NET exception;
is a class where you organize your

You will use this class potentially from every business module, so it's
better for this to be included in the most base business module.

info
codes. In the previous example we've seen
error should have the first error code in

...
public NameShouldBeUnique() : base(Common.Err(0)) { } // First error of 'Common' code block
...

children.value:
You may create a code block for every business module, so that error codes
are grouped according to their business domain.
You can accept parameters in your exception classes;
Last parameter of base constructor accepts

so that
you can add as many parameters as you want. This parameters are used in
building the exception message that is included in the response.

Error messages will be asked to localization with a key that is unique to each
result code. For example,

To include parameters in messages, you can use a format string as your message
such as
'{0}' already exists, name should be unique
